```{python}
# Given data for the bar chart
data = {
    'airport': ['ATL', 'ORD', 'DEN', 'SFO', 'SLC', 'SAN', 'IAD'],
    'num_flights': [35000, 29000, 20000, 12500, 10000, 6500, 5500]
}

# Creating a DataFrame from the given data
flights_per_airport = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Visualize the data
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='airport', y='num_flights', data=flights_per_airport, palette="viridis")
plt.title('Number of Flights per Airport')
plt.xlabel('Airport Code')
plt.ylabel('Number of Flights')
plt.yticks(np.arange(0, 40001, 5000))
plt.show()

```
